revised_title: On the Absorption of Gases by Liquids and the States of Matter
tldr: The author investigates the absorption of gases by liquids under high pressure and the effects on the states of matter. They discover that the cohesion and capillarity of a liquid depend solely on temperature, and that pressure has no effect on these properties. The study also reveals that the less soluble a gas is in a liquid, the less effect its presence has at any pressure.
